Key Match Events: Luguentz Dort poured in 20 points, leading the Oklahoma City Thunder to a 105-93 victory over the visiting San Antonio Spurs.
Victor Wembanyama limped to the locker room after seemingly injuring his foot during a post-up in the second quarter and struggled to make an impact upon his return.
Wembanyama ended the night with a career-low six points, shooting just 1-of-5 from the field, while also grabbing eight rebounds.
Chet Holmgren scored seven points during a 14-7 run to help Oklahoma City stretch its lead to 42-26 at the 7:15 mark of the second quarter.
Holmgren had 19 points on 7-of-10 shooting, along with five rebounds and two blocks.
The Thunder made a season-high 17 from beyond the arc, including 13 before halftime.
Oklahoma City also tallied a season-best 28 assists.
The Thunder racked up 18 steals and converted 22 San Antonio turnovers into 27 points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Opponents are averaging 94.75 points per game against Oklahoma City, which is 4-0 for the first time since the 2016-17 season.
After Boston's loss at Indiana earlier in the night, the Thunder and the Cleveland Cavaliers are the only undefeated teams in the league.
